result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Logan N. Owen

records.addlTxt: Atty Hart received and waives reading of Information.  Atty Hart enters not guilty pleas.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Court enters not guilty plea(s) - set for trial.  Bond continued.

Atty Hart received and waives reading of Information.  Atty Hart enters not guilty pleas.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Court enters not guilty plea(s).  Atty Hart advises there is a potential global resolution with his older case with this case be dismissed but read in.  State believes the older case will resolve by global resolution with dismissal of this case.  Court sets this matter as a status to track with 20CF136.

Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Taylor Hart @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $50.00/month - Same payment schedule as 22CF9.
